sentences.english: Without all the facts, Helen could only assumption a band-aid.
sentences.chinese: 因为事实还不全体齐备，海伦只能臆测解决的方式。

sentences.english: I can only make some guesses, for the right to talk about funding.
sentences.chinese: 我在这里也只能作一些臆测，权作谈资。

sentences.english: No conjecture can be offered on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 关于这个问题不可臆测。

sentences.english: That surmises my goal as best as I can imagine.
sentences.chinese: 这是尽我所能对我的目标所进行的臆测。

sentences.english: Speculation is mounting over who will run for speaker and vice speaker of the Taipei and Kaohsiung city councils .
sentences.chinese: 谁将角逐北高两市议会正副议长宝座的臆测频频。

sentences.english: Cao Zhengsun four discuss the case, Cao Zheng speculation Duan Weiping killed two people.
sentences.chinese: 曹政孙四康讨论案情，曹政臆测段伟平杀了两个人。

sentences.english: In the early days, archaeology of the region tended toward credulity.
sentences.chinese: 早期时候，在这个领域考古偏于轻信臆测。

sentences.english: No assumptions about its internal data structure can be made.
sentences.chinese: 您也不必臆测它会有什么内部资料结构。

sentences.english: Its insufficient aspect mainly has some words conjectured subjectively.
sentences.chinese: 其不足之处主要足存在一些主观臆测之词。

definition: lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to jump to an unfounded conclusion
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
